utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: There were some nice guys there, but they're all so quiet. Awkward smiles and sweaty palms. I'm not expecting Brad Pitt to walk into St. Theresa's. Just... someone who makes me laugh. Has a nice smile.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: Full head of hair. You know, someone like you, Mr. Franklin.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: It's a shame they're going to cremate you.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: Martin!

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: Martin!

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: My purse is right there. Go ahead. Take whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: Irene? You call me?

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: Irene?

utterance.speaker: MARTIN
utterance.content: Irene!

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: How're you doing?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: FYI, if you ask me, it's more the guy's fault than yours. And House isn't blameless either. If he hadn't pitted us all against each other...

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Was that always there?

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS BRENNAN
utterance.content: Hello. Sure.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS BRENNAN
utterance.content: It's House.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Gooood morning, Angels.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: As you will see from the file, we have quite the interesting case. Not often do you get a patient who sees dead people.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Uhh, what file?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: What the hell? I gave it to Bosley a half hour ago.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: It was not a half hour. It was ten minutes. And he made copies of the ER records first.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Less lip, more whip. I only agreed to take this case because you said that this Mocha Frappalicious would have whip on it.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: Fine. I'll refer the case to Foreman.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Can't. Mercy fired him.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Gimme.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: He got fired?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Disobeyed a superior officer under fire. He's lucky he wasn't executed.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: How do you know about it? You keeping tabs on him?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Girls talk.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: When Bosley drags his ancient ass in there...

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: I'm here. Twenty-four-year-old funeral cosmetician suffered a grand mal seizure at work.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Why does he get to be Bosley?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: You wanna be Bosley? Bosley's like the asexual messenger boy.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: She had a vision of being raped by a cadaver before passing out. Seizure rules out psychiatric illness. No history of epilepsy, head trauma, or drug use.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Bosley keeps his job while they replace five Angels over three seasons.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Could be a tumor to the temporal lobe.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Not with a normal CT scan.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: You mean it appeared normal to the doc in the ER.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Way to get right back on that horse, "Thirteen".

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Nice try, Cutthroat Bitch. That was the worst "Thirteen" imitation I've ever heard.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Funeral home prep rooms are filled with toxic chemicals.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS BRENNAN
utterance.content: And cadavers. Everybody in that place obviously died from something.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I have a question. Is he the one who's not a doctor?

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: Bullets aren't contagious. But infections, parasites...

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: You said one of us wasn't a doctor, and you called him a fraud.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: He's not a doctor. Continue, Boz.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: Could be an STD...

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Why isn't he fired?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, you're breaking up. I'm going into a tunnel.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Dark religious nut.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: What did you call me?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm sorry. What do you people want to be called this week?

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: Cole.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm never gonna remember that. Take Bosley and the other visible minority to the funeral home.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: The rest of you young white people, the world is your oyster. Get an MRI with contrast, EEG, LP, and blood panel. And, Angels, be careful.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: Just because he's religious doesn't mean he won't kick your ass.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You wanna bet?

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: No, I want you to stop being such a jerk to him.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: One hundred dollars.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Smart call. Guy's a wuss. He's gonna be the next one on the train.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: Define "kick your ass."

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Any physical confrontation...

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: Or verbal?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Define verbal.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: Anything over...seventy decibels. And you can't start suddenly being nice to him.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You realize what you're encouraging here.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: Yeah, someone kickin' your ass.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: The space inside is smaller than I thought.

utterance.speaker: CONNIE WALESA
utterance.content: Don't worry, Reena. The doctors are going to take good care of you, right?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Once the Valium kicks in, you'll feel better.

utterance.speaker: CONNIE WALESA
utterance.content: And then we'll have some nice, warm milk when you're done.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: I'd rather have more Valium.

utterance.speaker: CONNIE WALESA
utterance.content: Reena.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Let's wait just a bit, see how it goes.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Try to lie as still as possible.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I guess Father Time's a lock for one of the spots.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: "Thirteen"'s a lock.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: He doesn't have a medical license and he's still around.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: She killed a guy in a wheelchair. And his dog.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: He doesn't care about our qualifications or ideas. He just wants to have fun.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: And she's the ultimate fun 'cause he can't figure her out.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: This game is insane.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: So quit. Happy to lose the competition.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: If it's gonna be on your résumé, it's gotta be better to quit than get fired.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Either quit or shut up.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Actually, with House, getting fired might look better.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: That's why I left. We had different ideas on how to practise.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: To be honest, I don't think Dr. Schaffer really gave me a chance.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Saved a patient's life.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Have you spoken to her?

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Then why are you asking me what happened?

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: What'd she tell you?

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: That's what happened. Nothing more I can add to that.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: Cadavers were clean. So is her food. It's all organic unprocessed crap. It's gotta be the embalming fluid.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: Ethanol can have psychoactive effects...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Bosley! Tell whoever's talking he's an idiot.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Bosley. Either tell him he's an idiot, or tell me why I'm wrong.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: You're an idiot.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You actually think that I'd take a patient who had a seizure in a funeral home if the ER hadn't already ruled out embalming fluid?

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: I thought we weren't supposed to trust...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Idiot! From the old French, "idiote", meaning effeminate, mentally deficient moor.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: I found something in the mortuary's files from '05. A forty-eight-year-old male's cause of death was listed as pneumonia, but the symptoms in the autopsy report didn't fit. Uh, confusion, memory loss, depression.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Mad cow. Very cool.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: No, she's a vegetarian and only ate organic vegetables at that.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Tell him he's an idiot again.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: The disease can be spread by brain tissue.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Which is very cool. Run with it.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS BRENNAN
utterance.content: So because the answer might be "cool", you want us to do a brain biopsy on a twenty-four-year-old woman?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: No, because the answer is something cool, I want you to do a brain biopsy on a forty-eight-year-old dead guy.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: The guy's already been buried.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: We dig him up.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I am not digging up a body without a court order.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Don't think of it as digging up a body. Think of it as keeping another one from being buried.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: I can't do it.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: We gonna have another one of those ecumenical discussions where I tell you that your beliefs are ridiculous and you totally cave?

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: I just gotta be home at six.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: The Sabbath. The Lord works for six days, then tells the Union he needs a rest. You know, if I was all-powerful, I'd take at least two days.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, then it must be the kid.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You have oatmeal on your pants.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Do you have a camera in here?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: No. I was guessing. He had oatmeal on his pants yesterday and the day before. Have one of your wives look after the spawn.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: I'm a single dad.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Where's the single mom?

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Interesting. You claim a lapse of judgment, or you gonna admit that a lapse in judgment is a lapse in faith?

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS BRENNAN
utterance.content: He's gone.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Fair enough. Family comes first.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Dr. Cuddy, I'm Amber Volakis, one of Dr. House's new fellows.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Sexual harassment claims go through HR. Stress-related leaves through worker's comp, and any accusations of criminal activities go directly to the Princeton Plainsboro Police Department.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Actually, I was wondering if you needed any extra help in the clinic tonight.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: You're not going to score any points with House by kissing my ass.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Understood. But I hear Dr. House hates clinic duty. If he were to hear through the grapevine that I was willing to work overtime, take some of it off his hands...

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: My advice to you is to do whatever House wants you to do tonight. And then tomorrow night, you can come back and I will give you extra clinic duty.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Does everybody around here have trust issues?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: I don't know what House wants you to do, and I don't want to know. But if you really have a problem with it, quit now. It's only gonna get worse.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS BRENNAN
utterance.content: All right, who's up?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Not me.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: I'm a surgeon. If anything happens to these hands, I'm screwed. Let Bosley do it. As long as he can keep folding laundry, his career won't...

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: Shh, shh, shh. Someone's coming.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Shouldn't we be running?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: If it's a cop, run. Security guard, I say we take him down.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Sorry I'm late.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Where the hell have you been?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Oh, I got lost.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Been here over three hours.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Really lost. I brought coffee and donuts.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: So "Thirteen", you grow up around here?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I'm just making conversation. It's what people do. Why are you hiding everything? And I'm asking you that question because you're hiding everything. There's something seriously wrong with you. I'm worried.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Fine, but I am freaked, because I don't think you're a freak. I think you're doing this on purpose because you know House will be intrigued.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Honey, I'm home.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS BRENNAN
utterance.content: Get the crowbar.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: No, there's not enough room to maneuver a crowbar down here.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS BRENNAN
utterance.content: Oh, God help us.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Ankles. They buried the guy the wrong way around.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: The doctor's lounge is covered in mud.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Thirteen and Cutthroat Bitch had a disagreement, and the cafeteria was out of jell-o.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: There were pickaxes. Either you had them dig up a body, or you're building a railroad.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: A little tiny piece of his brain. Seemed a waste. He wasn't using it anymore.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: That's your defense? "We just dismembered him"?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: They're looking for Creutzfeldt-Jakob.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: You get the results yet?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Does my breath smell bated to you?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Yes. Let me know when you hear anything. And get that mess in the shower area cleaned up.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I know just the guy.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: How many of them agreed to dig up a grave?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Six.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: But don't worry, the one who didn't didn't stand on principle. He just had a diaper to change. I really think there are no bad choices in this group.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You guys don't wipe your feet when you come in the house?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Doctor's lounge. Let's go.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Why me?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, I can't ask the black guy or one of the chicks to do it. That would be insensitive.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: And you can't ask Bosley because that'd look like you only hired the non-doctor to do non-doctor stuff.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You keep stalling, you're still gonna clean up, but I won't let you have the mop.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS BRENNAN
utterance.content: Sample came back negative for Creutzfeldt-Jakob.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, that discussion didn't last long.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS BRENNAN
utterance.content: I just don't know what else there is. We had an idea. It was wrong.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, we can go home. I mean, we have no idea what's wrong with her. Which means it could be completely benign. Or, on the off chance that it's _killing_ her, we could take it again from the top.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: You've already done everything.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: We may have missed something.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: I just want to go home. I'm sure I'm fine now.

utterance.speaker: CONNIE WALESA
utterance.content: Reena, the doctors know best.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: If I have another one, I'll come right back, okay?

utterance.speaker: CONNIE WALESA
utterance.content: If you have it while you're driving...

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: You can drive me. Make sure I take it easy.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: My mother.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: Your mother's here?

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: What are you talking about? She's right there.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You sampled every bodily fluid, peeked in her brain, violated a cadaver's privacy, dug up a body...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: ... but missed the fact she was still seeing things that weren't there.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Be nice if one of you Angels-slash-morons had a clue why.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: We did a full history. She never mentioned seeing or hearing anything unusual.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, well, as long as she never said anything. How were you to know? Same thing with the spinal fluid? She tell you that was fine?

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS BRENNAN
utterance.content: The labs were all clear.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Then either we're about to meet the Alpha and Omega, or you missed something.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: We missed the new symptom.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: It's not a new symptom. We always knew she had hallucinations.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: Seeing her dead mother's a hallucination. Not knowing she's dead is a delusion.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You keep this up, you're gonna have to start wearing sexier clothes.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Uh, carbon monoxide could also cause delusions. A lot of haunted houses report...

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: There's no headache. No tachycardia. I guess they didn't cover that at your medical school.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: In Ukraine, twenty years ago. Good luck trying to get those records.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: We start new records. Test for every hereditary disease that fits the symptoms.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: There are at least forty different mitochondrial disorders, another couple hundred...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Start with amyloidosis, keep going until you reach... zamyloidosis.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: Now what are you testing for? Or should I ask what you're not testing for?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Well, we could narrow it down if you could remember what your mother died from.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: My mother is not dead. She's sitting right there.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Do you think we're lying to you?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: You lose your mother?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Do you think we're trying to trick you? Why would we do that?

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: Because you're mean. And you're not good at your job.

utterance.speaker: CONNIE WALESA
utterance.content: Reena, stop. You're being cruel.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: They're wasting time. Doing exactly what the guy in the wheelchair said they'd do.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: You know who I'm talking about. He's been hanging around ever since they brought me in. Complaining about how incompetent everyone is. Said you killed his dog.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: It doesn't make any sense.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'm not interested.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: If you weren't interested, you wouldn't be here.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: I thought it was social.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: No, you didn't. You always think there's an agenda.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: That's why I left.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: That's why you're good. You need a job.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'll find a job.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: And I need someone that understands House.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: They'll learn.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: I need someone that can control House.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Heh! Keep looking. Might take a while.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: I'll cut the salary of everyone else on the team fifteen percent, give it to you. That's more than you'll get anywhere else.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: What does House say about this?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: You're the one person on the team that he always respected.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: This restaurant is twenty minutes out of your way. Half an hour out of mine. You picked it to make sure House didn't drop in on us.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: It's my decision, not his.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: And you tell him that, then run back to your office while I get to deal with him. I left for a reason. That reason hasn't changed.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: So... what's the news?

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS BRENNAN
utterance.content: Everything's negative so far.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes. Why wait to finish before reporting to me? I have things to do, you know.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: She's seeing someone else.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: That's not news. That's "olds".

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Dammit. Why did God design the human body this way?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: A guy in a wheelchair.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: In a hospital. It's enough to give you the heebie-jeebies.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: He had a dog. She's seeing Stark. Our last patient.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, if it's Stark, he wouldn't be haunting a patient, he'd be haunting the doctor who killed him.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Probably? You think there's a possibility that the alternative is true?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Then go away.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS BRENNAN
utterance.content: We're wasting time. We ran thirty two gels. We could run a hundred more. Without knowing how her mother died...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You're gonna have to run a hundred more. And by you, of course, I'm only referring to the people who care enough about human life to put in a full day. You wanna carpool?

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: H-how do you expect me to respond to this stuff?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Exactly like you just did. I have a theory. Maybe you can help me out. Black Mormon means masochist. Means kinky.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm thinking that someone got hurt making the bastard. Am I right?

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: You leave my son out of this.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I wasn't referring to your kid's hypocrisy. I was referring to yours.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: Why don't we just ask her how she died, hmm?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Because she won't tell us. She thinks her mother's still alive.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: I don't mean ask the patient, I mean ask her mother.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Cool.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: What the hell does that mean? You guys talking your own language now?

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I'll try to include some visual aids next time.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: Now what?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm Dr. House. 'S your mom around?

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: Why should I tell you? You're just going to tell me I'm lying or crazy.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Not gonna do that. I really need to know what she has to say.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: What do you want?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: When you were young, was she...?

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: No, not you. Him.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: No. He's old.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: Actually, looks like you.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah, that's Grandpa House. Tell him to call back on a land line. Terrible reception in here. How much pain was your mom in?

utterance.speaker: OLD GENTLEMAN
utterance.content: It's Walter.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: He says his name is Walter.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Can I... help you?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: My patient's talking to my Grandpa Walt.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: You have a Grandpa Walt?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Nope. Which is what made me suspect that maybe she's not actually seeing into the afterlife.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: What is this sudden obsession with the afterlife?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Only obsession is with the idiots in the right-here-and-now life who think there's an afterlife.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: And you want me to...?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Nothing. Just need a place to hang low for awhile. I'm pretending to be spooked.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Because...?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Because if my soon-to-be-brain-dead patient thinks that I believe her, maybe she'll let me chat with her mother's ghost.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: The one you don't believe exists.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Exactly. The ghost is a hallucination, which is the result of a delusion which most likely is the result of a hereditary disease that her mother died from when the patient was four.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: And you think you can tap into her subconscious memory by tapping into her hallucination.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hmm-mm. She might not know what caused her mother's death, but she will know how she acted before she died.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: You're quite impressed with yourself right now, aren't you?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Who wouldn't be? Well, that should be long enough. Back in a flash.

utterance.speaker: JAMES WILSON
utterance.content: Take your time.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Is my grandfather still here?

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CONNIE WALESA
utterance.content: He should be right back.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: He just went to get some warm milk.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: But your mom's still here, right?

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: Yes, of course.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I know she's fine now, but when you were four or five, she got sick.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You sure? She wasn't in any pain?

utterance.speaker: CONNIE WALESA
utterance.content: I wasn't in pain.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: She was just tired. And sometimes she would stay in bed all day.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Did she ever fall down?

utterance.speaker: CONNIE WALESA
utterance.content: Of course. Everyone falls down once in awhile.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: Sometimes. Not that often.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: How often?

utterance.speaker: CONNIE WALESA
utterance.content: Maybe it was actually more than once in awhile. Remember that time in the bathroom?

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: Hmm. A few times. Once she hit her head on the bathroom sink. There was blood all over the floor. I-I got it on my sweater. And...

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: They took her away.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah, to the place where the doctor made her better. But before that, what about her arms and legs? Did she ever walk funny? Like sort of bent over?

utterance.speaker: CONNIE WALESA
utterance.content: I thought that was from growing up on the farm.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: What about her hands? She ever have any difficulty sewing, buttoning a shirt?

utterance.speaker: CONNIE WALESA
utterance.content: No. But sometimes, my hands would, um, shiver. Like I was cold. But I wasn't. I never quite understood.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: She used to get the shivers like she was cold.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Start her on l-dopa and bromocriptine. It's just Parkinson's.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: Cole. How's it going with your patient?

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: Still seeing stuff.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: I hear House is treating you like crap.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: He treats everyone badly.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: Yeah, but I heard you're special.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: Oh, I can handle it.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: Maybe you shouldn't. He's gonna walk all over you if you let him.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: That says nothing about me, just him.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: House respects people who aren't afraid of him. Get in his face. Yell if you have to.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: I don't need his respect.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: You do if you want the job.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: Thanks for the advice.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: You have to hold still!

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: I'm trying!

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Damn! Hold her down!

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: No! Stop it!

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: No... no!

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: No! No! No!

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: You stabbed me.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: My arm is bleeding.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Lesions aren't explained by Parkinson's.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Any theories?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: A ghost got your tongue?

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: What about vasculitis?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: MRI didn't indicate any cerebral ischemia.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: But she has shown some focal weakness, urinary retention.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Yes, those are her big mystery symptoms. Not the hallucinations that vasculitis doesn't explain.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: Unless it's retinal vasculitis.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: House, this guy may be smart, and I'm sure he's great to share a beer with. But if he doesn't know that visual symptoms are an electrical issue, not vascular; two separate systems...

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: So are the banks and the power grid. But if I don't pay my bills, my lights go out.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Vasculitis restricts blood flow to nerves, messes with electrical function.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Acute intermittent porphyria's a better fit.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: If you're wrong about porphyria, the treatment could box her kidneys. Vasculitis is treated with corticosteriods. Relatively harmless.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Start her on the steroids.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: House...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: And test for both so he'll stop whining.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Big Love, have I humiliated you in the last half hour?

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Check your email.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: How's it going?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Great. The only way he could turn any more cheeks is by pulling down his pants.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: He's not a wuss. It takes a lot more strength...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey, we didn't bet on how strong he was.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: So you're gonna collect a hundred dollars and fire him because he has principles?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: What's your agenda here? Obviously don't care about the hundred.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: He's a decent, smart...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You don't care about the team.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: Does it annoy Wilson when you ask questions and ignore the answers?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Very much. You only care about who I hire and who I fire, 'cause you miss going through my mail. You can't stop controlling me.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: No one controls you.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Want your job back?

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Too bad. You can't have it.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She'll take care of this.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You can take it out of the $100 you're gonna owe me.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yes, he is.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: I agree. I-I learned an awful lot from him.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: About a month. Dr. Schaffer was great, but just wasn't the right fit.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: It was, uh, it was a tough situation. I probably could've handled it better.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: There was an unusual lactic acid level in one of her labs. I had a similar case a few months ago.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: Well, my stones are on the market.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: If the signals are misfiring, it'll confirm that an old man without a medical license is smarter than all of us. That your hallucinations were caused by...

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: They're not hallucinations. Tell her, mom.

utterance.speaker: CONNIE WALESA
utterance.content: Honey, they're doctors. They must know what they're doing.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: If they know what they're doing, how'd they kill that poor man's dog?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: C'mon, this has got to be freaking you out a little bit.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: There's nothing to be ashamed of here. If the ghost of a man you killed doesn't screw with your head, there's something wrong with your head.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: See, that freaks me out.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Oh, absolutely. That makes sense. The dog was in here getting his eyes checked and forgot to put his jewelry back on.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: This isn't working. You're just making me sicker like he said you...

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: My stomach, it hurts.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Code in the eye lab.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: I can't. It hurts. Why won't you help me?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: Spleen's ripe to bursting. You guys thought it was vasculitis?

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: You used to be on House's team, right?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: Yeah. There's a lot of blood in here. Sponge.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: You got any advice for me?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: You always put up with this crap?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: Was it a mistake?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: It was irrelevant.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: He fired you.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: He'll fire you either way... eventually.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: Dr. Cameron told me...

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: Don't wanna know.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: 'Cause... House is watching.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: Not a metaphor. Look up.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You guys gonna shoot the breeze or you gonna do something about all that bleeding?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: That's not coming from the spleen. It's the liver.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: It's necrotic.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT CHASE
utterance.content: She's dying from the inside out.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Enlarged spleen and liver failure are classic AIP. It's porphyria and it's moving fast.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: PBGs were negative. If you read the report...

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: PBG tests are only conclusive if done during an attack, which you would know if you were a real doctor.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: That is just great.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: What is?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Which one of us is?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Both of you. Together. Fighting. Passionate to prove the other one wrong. Couldn't care less about the patient, but it all works out the same.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I hate "Thirteen".

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Not as productively. Continue.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: It could still be vascular.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: Vasculitis is off the board. Steroid treatment didn't help.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: Vascular isn't just vasculitis. Something's gotta be cutting off the blood supply to her liver and spleen.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Do a visceral angiogram.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: This is a joke, right? He can't be right every single time. You're feeding him your ideas just to embarrass us.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: If I wanted to embarrass you, I'd... have you mop up the doctor's lounge.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: Heavenly father, I pray thee that Thou shalt give the Holy Ghost unto all them that shall believe in Thy words.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: Irene. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: I need to touch it.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS BRENNAN
utterance.content: Irene, put your hand down.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: No, give it to me! I want it! Give it to me!

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: What'd the angio say?

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: We couldn't finish. She started groping me.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You couldn't let her get to second base just to get the test done?

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: I think that's third base.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS BRENNAN
utterance.content: She was convulsing, delirious, and hyper-salivating. We had to knock her out with lorazepam.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, it's definitely not vascular.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: What do you want us to do?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Question is, what would Joseph Smith do?

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: This isn't the time for...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Casting out the demons?

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: The patient's not possessed, she's dying. You can mock me tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You believe that the Book has all the answers.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: To morality, not science!

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: But the book is inconsistent with science. You know how many epileptics were tortured because they were possessed? How many teenage witches were stoned to death 'cause they took mushrooms?

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: Just shut up already! We got a patient dying!

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Either got to prescribe an exorcism or admit to me that Smith was a horny fraud.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I know what she has.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You couldn't have spoken up ten seconds ago? You coulda saved me a hundred bucks.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Mushrooms weren't the only thing that got people stoned to death. Jimsonweed, belladonna, mandrake root, and... moldy bread. It's ergot poisoning.

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: ... completely unprocessed and untreated like what's in that organic rye bread she's been eating. Should I be going home?

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Is it six o'clock?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: It's why she got worse on the bromocriptine. It's an ergot derivative.

utterance.speaker: TRAVIS BRENNAN
utterance.content: There hasn't been a case in fifty years.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: She kept asking for milk. Dairy products counteract the effects.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Cravings based on actual needs. It's a fairly common evolutionary development.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: You okay with an answer based on evolution?

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Hypocrite.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: It's the stuff they make LSD from. The treatment you're on should...

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: So I've just been... tripping?

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: She's not here?

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: The fact that you're even willing to accept that answer means the medicine is starting to work.

utterance.speaker: CONNIE WALESA
utterance.content: But you'll live. You're beautiful, Reena.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: You too, mama.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: I'm going to miss you.

utterance.speaker: IRENE WALESA
utterance.content: Mama.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: As you know, there are seven of you and... only six roses.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: Those are peonies.

utterance.speaker: LAWRENCE KUTNER
utterance.content: But I'm sure they're part of the rose family.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Actually, I'm surprised there are seven of you. You punch your boss and stick around?

utterance.speaker: JEFFREY COLE
utterance.content: Gimme the flower and shut up.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Don't overdo it. Now I would love to keep all of you. But not enough to do anything about it. So according to my arbitrary schedule, one of you has to go.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: You're kidding.

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: I came up with the answer. I robbed a grave. I...

utterance.speaker: AMBER VOLAKIS
utterance.content: No, I never...

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm sure she did it. That's why she's getting the flower. It was beautiful.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She just overreached. She got into your head.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: She owned you. Planting the idea was good. Letting it fester was good. Leaving the collar was stupid. Well known fact, ghosts don't leave things lying around.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, my goodness. I'd totally forgotten about you two. Well played.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Sorry, Henry.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: We had some giggles.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS TAUB
utterance.content: You agreed with everything he said. You finished each other's sentences.

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: That's why I gotta go. Don't need someone to tell you what you're already thinking.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Funny, I was gonna say that.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: If you want to hang out...

utterance.speaker: HENRY DOBSON
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. Um, call Wilson.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Rest of you, eight o'clock tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: Cash will be fine.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: I bet you say that to all the guys.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Take your blood money.

utterance.speaker: GREG HOUSE
utterance.content: Who are you gonna protect next?

utterance.speaker: ALLISON CAMERON
utterance.content: If I told you, it wouldn't work.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: I've rethought some things.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: Glad to hear it.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'm prepared to come back on a number of conditions. I want the raise you promised, plus five percent. I want my own office and a personal assistant.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: It's not unreasonable.

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: I will give you... none of those. You can come back at your original salary.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: LISA CUDDY
utterance.content: You haven't rethought anything. You've just been blackballed. You're "House Lite" now. The only administrator that will touch you is the one who hired "House Classic". Good news is, she'll pretend she's not doing you a favor.

utterance.speaker: ERIC FOREMAN
utterance.content: I can start Monday.
